reporter_caption.center: MATTER OF THE MARRIAGE OF HAMILTON, 78 Or. App. 185 (1986)

caption.center: In the Matter of the Marriage of HAMILTON, Respondent, and HAMILTON,

opinion.posture: Appeal from Circuit Court, Jefferson County, John M. Copenhaver, Judge.
opinion.attorneys:
Richard E. Forcum, Bend, argued the cause for appellant. With him on the brief were Paul J. Speck and Forcum, Parker Speck, Bend.
Warren John West, Bend, argued the cause and filed the brief for respondent.
opinion.panel: Before Richardson, Presiding Judge, and Warden and Newman, Judges.
opinion.opinion_text:
PER CURIAM
Paragraph 7 of decree modified by reduction of judgment to $900; otherwise affirmed. No costs to either party.Page 186

Wife appeals a decree of dissolution, challenging several of its provisions. On de novo review we affirm the decree with the exception of paragraph 7, which provides:
"Petitioner [husband] shall have a judgment against Respondent [wife] for delinquent mortgage payments in the sum of $1,135.00."
Husband concedes that the proper amount of the judgment is $900.
Paragraph 7 of the decree is modified by reduction of the judgment to $900; otherwise the decree is affirmed. No costs to either party.Page 187
